intro: Tricarpelema chinense, commonly known as the Chinese tricarpelema, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its botanical features include palmate leaflets and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage.
